The claim was published on Facebook on D: 2016, and has been shared more than 200 times.
The post: s Thai-language caption warns against using salt water to clean vegetables and fruits, stating that it can make insecticide residues more long-lasting.
Expert Dr: Tirayut Vilaivan from Chulalongkorn University's Department of Chemistry stated that salt water doesn't make chemical residues in vegetables and fruits more long-lasting. He mentioned that most insecticides can't be diluted in water, making salt water only 30-40% effective in removing them.
Dr: Jessada Denduangboripant of Chulalongkorn University mentioned on his Facebook page in 2014 that salt water can potentially help remove insecticides from fruits and vegetables, as salt can make oil compounds separate from each other.
